newsitem.title: USA: Deadly fire hits apartment complex in Kentucky.
newsitem.headline: Deadly fire hits apartment complex in Kentucky.

text.p: A deadly fire swept through an apartment complex in Earlington, Kentucky, Tuesday causing the top floor of the three-story building to collapse and knocking out phone services to the town, authorities said.

"We do know that there were fatalities but we don't know how many, and we won't know until the building cools and we can get in there," Trooper Bryan Pitney of the Kentucky State police post at Madisonville said.

He told Reuters initial reports that five had died could not be confirmed and speculation that arson was involved was not correct. "We have no idea what started the fire and at this moment we are not looking at arson as the cause," he said.
A spokeswoman for the state fire marshal's office said the blaze, which caused the third floor to collapse, continued to burn several hours after it was first reported.
The fire along Earlington's Main Street knocked out phone service to the town of 1,800, 140 miles southwest of Louisville, fire marshal's spokeswoman Carol Czirr said.
